channel.title: Gaming Accesories
channel.description:
Hey everyone!
I think I have found the best possible computer for gaming (well atleast from what I have to choose from which is not so good), It has 8gbs of RAM, 1TB of memory (or 1064 gb...sometim like that), I dont know much about thew quad core processor brand, but if you all could look into it for me that would be amazing, or just tell me if that type is good or not. The only thing is that I am going to have to upgrade the graphics card (mayb even the sound card if I have enough money).
So here it is tell me what you all think. And I want to be able to play games on high quality without lag, so if the cards in there don't work does anyone have a recomended card that I should get?
http://www.officemax.com/technology/computers/desktop-computers/product-prod2850255?history=wthnkt89|categoryId~10004^categoryName~Technology^parentCategoryID~category_root^prodPage~25^region~1@pr3xl265|categoryId~283^categoryName~Computers^parentCategoryID~cat_10004^prodPage~25^region~1^refine~1@jnv24zts|prodPage~15^refine~1^region~1^categoryName~Desktop+Computers^categoryId~324^parentCategoryID~cat_283@fu53w4nu|refineName~Hard+Drive+Size^prodPage~15^refine~1^sub_attr_name~1^region~1^refineValue~1+TB

item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

my dad has that computer. It’s nice, not alienware… hell no… but it runs games fine

item.title: Gaming Accesories
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

Do you have any graphics cards to recommend?

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming Accesories
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

The card in it definitely won’t be enough to play most games on High Quality.
256MB integrated shared graphics memory - This isn’t barely enough to play most games on high detail, plus the fact that it’s integrated (Most integrated gfx cards are shit).

8GB RAM is a bit too much imo, I’d never really need that much unless i was hardcore multitasking e.g. IDE open, gaming, watching videos, listening to music (I can do this with my 4GB however I can’t really do much more).

So yeah it seems alright, though, I’d HIGHLY recommend that you buy 1 or 2 new graphics cards to put in there if you want to game properly.

Read full topic
